intro: Uncinia kingii, commonly known as the King's hook-cradle, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
